One of the best games with a great replay value.  L4D2 was ultimately disappointing, but L4D1 stands on its own as a masterpiece.  My only hope is that a future sequel can capture the magic that was made with this first game.

This is no longer worth even considering buying since all the campaigns have been converted to Left 4 Dead 2. The majority of the fanbase is on the new game too. The people who still play this are usually tournament players who don't like how messy the gameplay got with the addition of new special infected.

Une atmosphère captivante, un gameplay et une jouabilité réussit  (pour la version PC) (console de salon pas encore testée) et des sensations intenses  où une horde de zombies voraces qui sort de nulle part vous saute dessus.
Le travail en équipe est de rigueur, la survit du groupe tient uniquement à son unité !!r Runner s'abstenir :)

La durée de vie du jeu (cartes officielles) est de l'ordre de 4h (en mode compagne), ce qui très court pour des jeux de 7eme génération, mais qu'à cela ne tienne, il existe plus d'une centaine de carte téléchargeable gratuitement depuis des sites spécialisé en ce genre...En plus des modes Versus et Survival ! 

Un jeu en en coopération où le mot équipe prend tout son sens ce qui donne tout l'intérêt à ce jeu, qui sans doute ont aura beaucoup de mal à lâcher dans un moyen terme, tout comme pour certains jeux de chez  Valve : la série Counter Strike, TF...

A bon entendeur, amusez -vous !!
Grafik nichtmehr 100% Aktuell aber das gleicht der Hammer Versus Mode aus !

Want to blow away some bloodthirsty zombies?  This is the game.  The characters are memorable and endearing.  The game is extremely focused on team play, covering each others backs and working as a unit to survive.  1 second of distraction can spell death for an entire team.  This game will keep even the most skilled players on their toes, especially in the versus apect of this game which is extremely competetive.  The only downside to this game is that you may sometimes be paired with players who rush or grief intentionally.  So it is definitely recommended that you play with friends.

This is the best version of the L4D series both graphically, atmospheric, and overall control and feel.  The downside, Valve recognized early on that its a VS game and the VS special infected were out gunned by the survivors.  Valve started production (remaking l4d from ground up at valve) on L4D2 3 months after L4D was released.  L4D was released with 2 maps playable and 2 missing maps.  VS maps took over 6 months to finish (climb spots, etc...).  This frustrated most as L4D should have had devoted time to and L4d2 could have been a simple map and special infected update rather than a new game.  BOO on this one valve.

Better than the sequel, but not as much gore. The characters are a lot more memoriable. The gameplay is a lot better, even for Co-Op. It's just a sad thing the developers made a 2nd title only a year after this one was released, leaving the entire fan-base feeling used and sore, much like a COD fan.

Une ambiance prenante, un gameplay intelligent et des sensations intenses font de Left 4 Dead une franche réussite. Le titre fait en sorte que les joueurs puissent se marrer en ligne sans trop se prendre la tête. Car au fond, même si la survie d'un groupe tient à son unité et sa coordination, on aura quand même du mal à critiquer un joueur qui, emporté dans une folie destructrice, se sépare de son équipe et met tout le monde en danger. Voilà finalement ce qui donne tout son intérêt à Left 4 Dead, ce film de zombies interactif qu'on aura sans doute beaucoup de mal à lâcher dans les prochains mois.
nice game focused mainly on co-op gameplay with up to 4 people working together. really fun to play with friends.
A really gritty experience compared to the second. Even though it's missing melee weapons, you can't call yourself a zombie fan without owning this game. GET IT!

Left 4 dead is a fantastic Zombie survival game. Ur only main mission is to get to the evac and escape the zombies. U get to choose which survivor to play as, from An army guy to a guy that hates everything to a peelz addict to a female. This game features: Tier 1 and Tier 2 weapons, messages from other surrvivors, Peelz, and fun multiplayer. Sorry thats really all i have to say about this game i cant think of anything else.

Note from 2016: Left 4 Dead 2 now has every map of this game. You can buy this to obtain the old achievements which involved the original special infected or you can buy this just to see your own feet.

Cost:$20
Rating:78/100 Good

Anyone who has any knowledge of video games has heard of left for dead. Left for dead is valves genius answer to a new way of playing a zombie co-op video game.

There may not be much of a story with left for dead, as in the terms of a single player story, but left for dead is a game which doesn't require it, as the replay value of multiplayer is beyond excellent.

I can play left for dead for hours on end and not get bored. There's many different types of modes to play including versus, survival, single player, or the multiplayer campaign. Not only is it fun to use your voice to communicate with your other team members, but It's also fun to work together with strangers to reach your goal.

I love left for dead. I love the way It's a different style of zombie game. I love the way you have to co-operate with your other team members to survive each campaign and game mode. It's a great way of meeting new friends, and having a good blast.

Left for dead is a must buy for any gamer.

This is one of the best Zombie shooters out there. I have played L4D on both the computer and Xbox 360, but I prefer PC gaming to console gaming. This game is difficult on the hardest difficulty, but teamwork should help you survive the waves of horde. The Special infected may seem odd at first, but they are actually a great addition, because it would be far too easy with only common infected.
One of the most addicting games I have ever played! I absolutely love and recommend it to all! KILLING ZOMBIES FTW!

Quanto à parte financeira, ainda não sei se a Valve irá unir os dois jogos, mas enquando isso, esse jogo estará na minha lista dos favoritos . E que eu consiga o L4D2!

This game, like its successor, is meant to be played at a brisk pace. If you can appreciate quick gameplay; shooting while constantly racing to the end, I recommend this. If you tend to enjoy more "hold-out" survival games, like Killing Floor, keep in mind this is a different experience all together.

★★★★
El juego es divertidisimo. Las armas me parecen suficientes (hay 12. solo he encontrado 6 y me sobran la mitad) Hay un monton de situaciones que hacen pensar en el verdadero sentido del modo cooperativo. Hay enemigos que te eliminan solo con verte y si no hay quien te ayude, pues adios...
 
Graficamente cumple perfectamente. La musica te situa en la accion perfectamente y te mantiene en vilo. y las toneladas de zombies hacen que sea impusible decir que te lo has pasado y te has aburrido, porque no te dejaran en paz durante todo el juego.
 
Creo que no es un juego revolucionario, pero si que mezcla muy bien lo que ya existe para crear una experiencia equilibrada, divertida y duradera por lo que considero que merece un sobresaliente alto y lo recomiendo como compra obligada a todos los que les encanten los zombies y los fps en eso orden u el otro. Valve no nos ha engañado, el juego es genial.

If you're familiar with [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/trar/recommended/550]Left 4 Dead 2[/url], this is basically the same game but with less features. Purists would call it streamlined. For the uninitiated, Left 4 Dead is a fast-paced multiplayer FPS where four survivors must work together to survive a zombie apocalypse, fighting hordes of fast-moving Common infected and Special infected with unique abilities. It's a fun game with friends and has proven to be popular ever since its initial release in 2008, with L4D2 maintaining a community of thousands of players even today.

In this original iteration, only the Hunter (fast pouncer), Smoker (long-range snarer), Boomer (kamikaze horde summoner), Witch (extremely dangerous if angered) and Tank (guess) appear.

There are four modes in L4D: Campaign (play through one of a number of 'campaigns' in the story with other people), Versus (like Campaign but additional people can control the Special infected), Survival (the hardest mode, where you must hold out for as long as possible against the Infected and set time records), and singleplayer (Campaign with bots on your computer).

Gameplay is directed by an AI system named The Director, who spawns items & enemies, and changes the level depending on the status of the survivors. The harder the difficulty, the more contempt it has for you.

The presentation, as befitting most Valve games, is stellar. The campaigns are presented as movies, with 'credits' after the end displaying gameplay stats and a separate music Director controlling the incidental music. It does a good job of creating a zombie-film like atmosphere. Overall, like its sequel, co-op in this game can be very fun.

Only thing of concern is the community. It's not abysmal, and it's probably not even as hostile as L4D2's Versus, but it's pretty small and you'll run into some toxic players, given how cooperative and intense this game can be. (Of course, given the smallish community you may also run into friendly veterans.) If you want to play Expert at all, be prepared to do some janky metagame stuff to fit in - killing players who are below 50 health when they reach the safehouse so they respawn at 50 being one example.


Now you might be wondering: with all of the official L4D campaigns ported over to the sequel, why should I play this? Well, there [i]are[/i] a number of differences that make L4D unique and worth at least one playthrough, even if it lacks Workshop mod support.


Regarding weaponry and equipment:

* The weapon animations are simply better than the sequel's. Fortunately, there are mods for L4D2 that improve on this, even porting the original L4D1 animations over.

* The pistols are M1911s instead of the SIG/Glock of L4D2. There are also L4D2 mods that port the M1911s over to the newer game.

* There are less guns, which means more meaningful weaponry choices. Tier one only has the pump shotgun and Uzi; tier two has the auto shotgun, M16 and hunting rifle. The shotguns function the most different: if you reload them from an empty magazine you must rack the chamber before firing. This makes a difference on the harder difficulties.

* The melee in non-versus games does not suffer from fatigue; you can keep doing it as long as you need. This is helpful when there are no melee weapons to choose from!

* There are only pipe bombs and Molotov cocktails; and no adrenaline shots, defibrillators or ammo packs. Which, again, can make for more of a challenge.


Regarding your enemies:

* Less Special infected (no Jockey, Charger or Spitter) make for a different and some say harder experience, not in the least because the SI that remain are more dangerous here.

* The Common infected appear different and more true to what Valve had in mind.


Regarding performance:

* The game runs better than L4D2.

* The HUD is streamlined and looks better.


Regarding aesthetics and other stuff like that:

* There are different achievements in L4D; for example you do not get achievements in L4D2 for beating the original campaigns on Expert. If you want credit for doing so, you'll want to do it here.

* L4D2's campaigns and aesthetics are action-horror oriented. L4D's are more horror-oriented. While this is largely carried over in the L4D2 ports of the original campaigns, the optimal experience is playing them in L4D.

* For those who enjoy glitches, there are a number in the original campaigns that have not been fixed. The Jesus Rock in Death Toll's finale is a prime example.

* You can see your legs when you look down.


Basically, Left 4 Dead distills the formula to its essence and consequently makes this first entry into the series a classic. I suppose this right here is why it's still being played in a nutshell.

Not to say that Left 4 Dead 2 isn't bad, because apart from the weapon animations and its larger but more toxic community it's really not worse - just different. If you want a different Left 4 Dead experience, or you want to ease your way into the franchise by picking it up at the source, I'd recommend this.

just awesome zombie killing co-op fun times!

Have friends? If not, you'll make 'em fast when the only thing standing between you and being torn apart by a rampaging horde of the undead is the first three folks you can find able to throw a pipe-bomb, fire a gun, or just pull your bleeding body out from under a pile of gore. And if it doesn't work, well, who wants to die alone?

This game is possibly the best game of it's kind. The graphics are awesome, the music is amazing and the characters are fun.
Left 4 Dead is a co-op game and when I say co-op I mean it. If you do not go into it with a team mentality in mind you WILL have a ton trouble getting through the levels. However if you a good sport and stick with your friends this game will be an blast.
The levels are interesting and beautiful with a lot of detail to them while giving just enough hints to get the players going in the right direction. The music gives the game great atmosphere also giving players hints at what enemies are going to come at them. Because of the enemy AI system you are gaurenteed to never play the same level the exact same way twice.
There is also a PVP though playing as the zombies is incredibly difficult at first because there is no way to practice as one before playing against other people. You can also play L4D single player as the bots work decently. 
All in all  L4D is great.
An instant classic
